thread.title: Leicester Mercury commented Petition for second EU Referendum signed by more than 13,000...
thread.title_full: Leicester Mercury commented Petition for second EU Referendum signed by more than 13,000...

author: Leicester Mercury
title: Leicester Mercury commented Petition for second EU Referendum signed by more than 13,000...
text:
Petition for second EU Referendum signed by more than 13,000 people in Leicestershire By Leicester Mercury | Posted: June 25, 2016 5 COMMENTS SHARES Petition for second EU Referendum signed by more than 13,000 people in Leicester... X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (5) 
More than 13,000 people in Leicestershire are among the one million signatories on a petition calling for a second EU referendum. 
The petition, which has been set up by William Oliver Healey, states: "We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement a rule that if the Remain or Leave vote is less than 60 per cent, based on a turnout less than 75 per cent, there should be another referendum." 
Petitions on the UK Government can be considered by parliament once they reach 100,000 signatures. 
Read more: UK votes to leave European Union with Leicestershire overwhelmingly backing Brexit - RECAP 
The number of people to sign the petition can be broken down by parliamentary constituency. 
In Leicester South 2,257 people had signed it by 11.45am today; in Leicester East 1,421 and in Leicester West 1,276 have signed. 
In the county, the largest number of people to sign it in live in Harborough district (1,791), following by Loughborough (1,786) and Rutland and Melton (1,786). 
In the Charnwood constituency 1,293 people have signed it, in Bosworth the figure was 1,235 and in South Leicestershire 1,372 had signed it. 
The areas with the highest number of people signing the petition are in London and Brighton. 
The UK voted to leave the EU by 52 per cent to 48 per cent. 
However, while Leicestershire districts all voted to leave , the city of Leicester narrowly voted to remain 51.1 per cent to 48.9 per cent. 
You can sign the petition here
